game_text: Japan was part of the Allied Powers during World War I.
The first computer bug was formed by faulty wires.
An octopus can fit through any hole larger than its beak.
Michael Jackson had a pet python named ‘Crusher’.
The Pythagorean theorem states that the square of the hypotenuse is equal to the product of the squares of the other two sides.
Manchester United won the 2013-14 English Premier League.
Leonardo DiCaprio won an Oscar for Best Actor in 2004's "The Aviator".
Matt Damon played an astronaut stranded on an extraterrestrial planet in both of the movies Interstellar and The Martian.
Joseph Stalin's real name was Ioseb Bessarionis dze Dzugashvili.
Scottish producer Calvin Harris is from the town of Dumfries, Scotland.
In the game "Racko" you may pick up ANY card from the discard pile.
Shrimp can swim backwards.
The sum of all the numbers on a roulette wheel is 666.
In 2016, the United Kingdom voted to stay in the EU.
There are 6 legendary cards in "Clash Royale".
Type 1 diabetes is a result of the liver working improperly.
The first "Metal Gear" game was released for the PlayStation 1.
Cucumbers are usually more than 90% water.
Ada Lovelace is often considered the first computer programmer.
The 2016 United States Presidential Election is the first time Hillary Clinton has run for President.
The card game "Munchkin" won the 2001 Origins Award for Best Traditional Card Game.
Solid Snake is actually a clone from the DNA of Big Boss in the Metal Gear Solid series' history.
Rabbits are rodents.
St. Louis is the capital of the US State Missouri.
The alternative rock band, They Might Be Giants, released their album 'Flood' in 1990.
The end credits sequence in Grand Theft Auto 5 is over half an hour long.
Roger Federer is a famous soccer player.
According to Greek Mythology, Atlas was an Olympian God.
Martin Luther King Jr. and Anne Frank were born the same year.
The last Windows operating system to be based on the Windows 9x kernel was Windows 98.
3 members of 2 Live Crew were arrested for playing songs from their album, As Nasty As They Wanna Be, live.
In "Undertale", the main character of the game is Sans.
Pink Guy's debut album was "Pink Season".
Zero factorial is equal to zero.
Donald Trump won the popular vote in the 2016 United States presidential election.
Scatman John's real name was John Paul Larkin.
Bob Ross was a US Air Force pilot.
In "JoJo's Bizarre Adventure", Father Enrico Pucchi uses a total of 3 stands in Part 6: Stone Ocean.
Wilt Chamberlain scored his infamous 100-point-game against the New York Knicks in 1962.
"27 Club" is a term used to refer to a list of famous actors, musicians, and artists who died at the age of 27.
Nova Scotia is on the east coast of Canada.
In the "Kagerou Daze" series, Shintaro Kisaragi is prominently shown with the color red.
BMW M GmbH is a subsidiary of BMW AG that focuses on car performance.
Water always boils at 100°C, 212°F, 373.15K, no matter where you are.
Rabbits can see what's behind themselves without turning their heads.
Blue Danube was one of the musical pieces featured in Disney's 1940's film Fantasia.
The snowmobile was invented by Canadian Joseph-Armand Bombardier in 1937.
The game "Jetpack Joyride" was created by "Redbrick Studios".
Minecraft wasn’t the original name to Minecraft.
The shotgun appears in every numbered Resident Evil game.
Hippopotomonstrosesquippedaliophobia is the irrational fear of long words.
Coca-Cola's original colour was green.
The US emergency hotline is 911 because of the September 11th terrorist attacks.
The Republic of Malta is the smallest microstate worldwide.
The Kingdom of Prussia briefly held land in Estonia.
Vincent van Gogh cut off one of his ears.
Faust is a playable character in "Guilty Gear Xrd Revelator".
The word "news" originates from the first letters of the 4 main directions on a compass (North, East, West, South).
Ashley Frangipane performs under the stage name Halsey.
Pac-Man was invented by the designer Toru Iwatani while he was eating pizza.
Metal Gear Solid V: The Phantom Pain runs on the Fox Engine.
Niko Bellic is the protagonist of Grand Theft Auto IV.
In Kill La Kill, the weapon of the main protagonist is a katana.
The communication protocol NFC stands for Near-Field Control.
Tennis was once known as Racquetball.
Shaquille O'Neal appeared in the 1997 film "Space Jam".
If you grab the bladed end of a longsword in a specific way, you will not cut yourself.
Gordon Freeman, the protagonist of "Half-Life", is said to have once had a ponytail.
The fourth funnel of the RMS Titanic was fake designed to make the ship look more powerful and symmetrical.
Theodore Roosevelt Jr. was the only General involved in the initial assault on D-Day.
Deadpool's identity is Slade Wilson.
The open source program Redis is a relational database server.
The PlayStation was originally a joint project between Sega and Sony that was a Sega Genesis with a disc drive.
Pluto is a planet.
The Olympics tennis court is a giant green screen.
You could walk from Norway to North Korea while only passing through Russia.
The French word for "glass" is "glace".
Sean Connery wasn't in "Indiana Jones and the Kingdom of the Crystal Skull" because he found retirement too enjoyable.
Switzerland has four national languages, English being one of them.
In Pokémon Sun and Moon, a male Salandit can evolve to a Salazzle.
In the movie The Revenant, DiCaprio's character hunts down the killer of his son.
Japan has left-hand side traffic.
California is larger than Japan.
The Hundred Years' War was fought for more than a hundred years.
In association football, or soccer, a corner kick is when the game restarts after someone scores a goal.
The chemical element Lithium is named after the country of Lithuania.
In "Starbound", the track played by the Decorated Music Box is named "Atlas".
Musical artist, Future, collaborated with Kendrick Lamar for the song: "Mask Off".
Sound can travel through a vacuum.
Tigers have one colour of skin despite the stripey fur.
A Facebook campaign placed Rage Against The Machine's "Killing in the Name Of" as the UK Christmas Number 1 in 2009.
The title of the 1969 film "Krakatoa, East_of Java" is incorrect, as Krakatoa is in fact west of Java.
Francis Bacon died from a fatal case of pneumonia while he was attempting to preserve meat by stuffing a chicken with snow.
The British organisation CAMRA stands for The Campaign for Real Ale.
The term "GTO" was originated by Ferrari?
The internet browser Firefox is named after the Red Panda.
In Until Dawn, both characters Sam and Mike cannot be killed under any means until the final chapter of the game.
There are a total of 20 races in Formula One 2016 season.
YouTube personality Jenna Marbles served as an executive producer of the film Maximum Ride (2016).
Is Tartu the capital of Estonia?
In the 1988 film "Akira", Tetsuo ends up destroying Tokyo.
A slug’s blood is green.
The movie "The Nightmare before Christmas" was all done with physical objects.
English new wave musician Gary Numan founded the video game development company Facepunch Studios in March 2009.
The cover of The Beatles album "Abbey Road" featured a Volkswagen Beetle in the background.
Super Mario Bros. was released in 1990.
Eurobeat is primarily an Italian genre of music.
The first Maxis game to feature the fictional language "Simlish" was The Sims (2000).
The word "Inception" came from the 2010 blockbuster hit "Inception".
The Southeast Asian island of Borneo is politically divided among 3 countries.
"Half-Life 2" runs on the Source Engine.
"Windows NT" is a monolithic kernel.
The United States was a member of the League of Nations.
In the original script of "The Matrix", the machines used humans as additional computing power instead of batteries.
In Kingdom Hearts the Paopu fruit is said to intertwine the destinies for two people forever.
"Number 16 Bus Shelter" was a child's name that was approved by the New Zealand government.
Anatomy considers the forms of macroscopic structures such as organs and organ systems.
In World of Warcraft lore, Thrall is the original wielder of "Doomhammer".
Despite being seperated into multiple countries, The Scandinavian countries are unified by all having the same monarch.
Adolf Hitler was born in Australia.
In the game "Subnautica", a "Cave Crawler" will attack you.
In Sonic the Hedgehog universe, Tails' real name is Miles Prower.
In the original Star Wars trilogy, David Prowse was the actor who physically portrayed Darth Vader.
The IBM PC used an Intel 8008 microprocessor clocked at 4.77 MHz and 8 kilobytes of memory.
The Windows 7 operating system has six main editions.
In the periodic table, Potassium's symbol is the letter K.
Marilyn Monroe was born on July 1, 1926.
In Riot Games "League of Legends" the name of Halloween event is called "The Reckoning".
In Battlestar Galactica (2004), Cylons were created by man as cybernetic workers and soldiers.
"Minions" was released on the June 10th, 2015.
Like his character in "Parks and Recreation", Aziz Ansari was born in South Carolina.
Tokyo is the capital of Japan.
In Portal, the Companion Cube's ARE sentient.
The ADAM collecters in the Bioshock series are known as Little Sisters.
Leonardo da Vinci was not the creator of the Mona Lisa.
"Rich Uncle Pennybags" from the board game "Monopoly" wears a monocle.
George Clinton, Vice President of the United States (1805-1812), is an ancestor of President Bill Clinton.
Finnish Lapphund dogs were used for herding reindeer.
In the Season One Championship of "League of Legends", the highest achievable rank was Diamond.
An episode of "The Simpsons" is dedicated to Moe Szyslak's bar rag.
In "Need for Speed: Porsche Unleashed", the player can only drive cars manufactured by Porsche.
The pickled gherkin was first added to hamburgers because a US health law required all fast-food to include a source of Vitamin C.
In 2008, Usain Bolt set the world record for the 100 meters with one shoelace untied.
ATP tennis hosted several tournaments on carpet court before being replaced to reduce injuries.
The character Plum from "No Game No Life" is a girl.
The video game "Fuel" has an open world that is 5,560 square miles?
The Statue of Liberty's official name is “Liberty Enlightening the World”.
The man that shot Alexander Hamilton was named Aaron Burr.
The protagonist's names in 'Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf', George and Martha, were derived from George Washington and his wife.
In "Resident Evil", only Chris has access to the grenade launcher.
In 1993 Swedish car manufacturer Saab experimented with replacing the steering wheel with a joystick in a Saab 9000.
The music group Daft Punk got their name from a negative review they recieved.
The Indie Game Development Studio Cing, developers of Hotel Dusk and Last Window, went bankrupt on March 1st, 2010.
The flag of South Africa features 7 colours.
The S in Harry S. Truman stands for "Samuel".
"Undertale" is an RPG created by Toby Fox and released in 2015.
The 2010 film "The Social Network" is a biographical drama film about MySpace founder Tom Anderson.
Assyrian king Sennacherib's destruction of Babylon in 689 BCE was viewed as a triumph by other Assyrian citizens.
The animated film "Spirited Away" won the Academy Award for Best Animated Feature at the 75th Academy Awards in 2003.
To bypass US Munitions Export Laws, the creator of the PGP published all the source code in book form.
The anime "Lucky Star" follows the story of one girl who is unaware she is God.
Salt is 100% composed of Sodium.
According to Norse mythology, Loki is a mother.
In "Overwatch," an allied McCree will say "Step right up" upon using his ultimate ability Deadeye.
The Sun rises from the North.
United States President John F. Kennedy was assassinated during his presidential motorcade in Atlanta, Georgia on November 22nd, 1963.
In Half-Life 2, if you play the zombies' speech in reverse, they actually speak coherent English.
Russia passed a law in 2013 which outlaws telling children that homosexuals exist.
Adolf Hitler was a german soldier in World War I.
No Game No Life first aired in 2014.
The French word to travel is "Travail"
TF2: The Heavy's voice actor, Gary Schwartz, voices the Demoman as well
The main playable character of the 2015 RPG "Undertale" is a monster.
When you cry in space, your tears stick to your face.
"Twenty One Pilots" made the song "The Motion" featuring Sampha.
One of Donald Trump's 2016 Presidential Campaign promises was to build a border wall between the United States and Mexico.
Joko Widodo has appeared in the cover of a TIME magazine.
George W. Bush lost the popular vote in the 2004 United States presidential election.
The band STRFKR was also briefly known as Pyramiddd.
A caterpillar has more muscles than humans do.
Fast food restaurant chains Carl's Jr. and Hardee's are owned by the same company.
Klingons respect their disabled comrades, and those who are old, injuried, and helpless.
The value of one Calorie is different than the value of one calorie.
Stagecoach owned "South West Trains" before losing the rights to FirstGroup and MTR in March of 2017.
Tupac Shakur died due to complications from being stabbed in 1996.
Hungary is the only country in the world beginning with H.
The two largest ethnic groups of Belgium are Flemish and Walloon.
The scrapped Sonic the Hedgehog 2 level "Hidden Palace Zone" was later reused in the iOS port of the game.
The 2011 movie "The Adventures of Tintin" was directed by Steven Spielberg.
Rhode Island is actually located on the US mainland, despite its name.
Donald Duck played the role of Bob Cratchit in Disney's 1983 adaptation of A Christmas Carol.
There is an island in Japan called Ōkunoshima, A.K.A. "Rabbit Island", so named because of it's huge population of rabbits.
Vietnam's national flag is a red star in front of a yellow background.
"Buffalo buffalo Buffalo buffalo buffalo buffalo Buffalo buffalo." is a grammatically correct sentence.
In "Avatar: The Last Airbender" and "The Legend of Korra", Lavabending is a specialized bending technique of Firebending.
The Harry Potter series of books, combined, are over 1,000,000 words in length.
Doki Doki Literature Club was developed in Japan.
"Neutral Milk Hotel" is a real band.
Franz Joseph I was the last emperor of Austria.
The Paradox Interactive game "Stellaris" was released in 2016.
In "The Sims" series, the most members in a household you can have is 8.
Clefairy was intended to be Ash's starting Pokémon in the pilot episode of the cartoon.
Video streaming website YouTube was purchased in it's entirety by Facebook for US$1.65 billion in stock.
The two atomic bombs dropped on Japan by the United States in August 1945 were named 'Little Man' and 'Fat Boy'.
"Typewriter" is the longest word that can be typed using only the first row on a QWERTY keyboard.
The Spitfire originated from a racing plane.
The M41 Walker Bulldog remains in service in some countries to this day.
American rapper Dr. Dre actually has a Ph.D. doctorate.
The "Berenstein Bears" is the correct spelling of the educational children's book series' name.
A defibrillator is used to start up a heartbeat once a heart has stopped beating.
Luigi is taller than Mario?
The game "Battlefield 1" takes place during World War I.
Tony Hawk's Pro Skater was released in 1999.
Skateboarding will be included in the 2020 Summer Olympics in Tokyo.
You are allowed to sell your soul on eBay.
"Ananas" is mostly used as the word for Pineapple in other languages.
The average woman is 5 inches / 13 centimeters shorter than the average man.
Sitting for more than three hours a day can cut two years off a person's life expectancy.
The television show Doctor Who first aired in 1963.
There are no deserts in Europe.
The full English name of the car manufacturer BMW is Bavarian Motor Works
In the "Half-Life" series, "H.E.V" stands for "Hazardous Evasiveness Vest"
Centripedal force is an apparent force that acts outward on a body moving around a center, arising from the body's inertia.
Stephen Chbosky wrote the book 'The Perks of Being A Wallflower'.
Rebecca Chambers does not appear in any Resident Evil except for the original Resident Evil and the Gamecube remake.
Abraham Lincoln was the first U.S. President to be born outside the borders of the thirteen original states.
Throughout the entirety of "Dragon Ball Z", Goku only kills two characters: a miniboss named Yakon and Kid Buu.
"Cube", "Cube 2: Hypercube" and "Cube Zero" were directed by the same person.
Microphones can be used not only to pick up sound, but also to project sound similar to a speaker.
The Windows ME operating system was released in the year 2000.
Pistons were added to Minecraft in Beta 1.5.
Harry Potter was born on July 31st, 1980.
Daft Punk originated in France.
All of these maps were in "Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six Siege" on its initial release: House, Clubhouse, Border, Consulate.
The Killer Whale is considered a type of dolphin.
In "Super Mario World", the rhino mini-boss, Reznor, is named after the lead singer of the band "Nine Inch Nails".
In Topology, the complement of an open set is a closed set.
In "Doctor Who", the Doctor gets his TARDIS by stealing it.
The Fiat Multipla is a drivable car in "Forza Horizon 3".
In "League of Legends", there exists four different types of Dragon.
Hidden in the files for "Mario Kart Arcade GP" is a picture of the Beslan school hostage crisis.
You can square root a negative number with an imaginary number "i".
Haggis is traditionally ate on Burns Night.
In the "S.T.A.L.K.E.R." series, the Freedom faction wishes to destroy the supernatural area known as  "the Zone".
Dave Grohl recorded the Foo Fighters' debut, "Foo Fighters," by himself.
Sir Issac Newton served as a Member of Parliament, but the only recorded time he spoke was to complain about a draft in the chambers.
Slovakia is a member of European Union-
The Python programming language gets its name from the British comedy group "Monty Python."
The original ending of "Little Shop Of Horrors" has the plants taking over the world.
Shub-Niggurath is a creature that was created by 	J. R. R. Tolkien in his novel "The Lord of The Rings".
Peter Molyneux was the founder of Bullfrog Productions.
Igneous rocks are formed by excessive heat and pressure.
Amazon acquired Twitch in August 2014 for $970 million dollars.
The name of the main character of the video game "The Legend of Zelda", is Zelda.
Han Solo's co-pilot and best friend, "Chewbacca", is an Ewok.
Greenland is almost as big as Africa.
Soulja Boy's 'Crank That' won a Grammy for Best Rap Song in 2007.
The "Gympie Stinger" is the deadliest plant in the world.
The very first recorded computer "bug" was a moth found inside a Harvard Mark II computer.
Leonardo da Vinci's Mona Lisa does not have eyebrows.
The programming language "Python" is based off a modified version of "JavaScript".
In the comic book "Archie", Betty is friends with Veronica because she is rich.
Pointers were not used in the original C programming language; they were added later on in C++.
Sargon II, a king of the Neo-Assyrian Empire, was a direct descendant of Sargon of Akkad.
The longest place named in the United States is Lake Chargoggagoggmanchauggagoggchaubunagungamaugg, located near Webster, MA.
Nutella is produced by the German company Ferrero.
"Metal Gear Solid 3: Snake Eater" takes place on Shadow Moses Island.
A scientific study on peanuts in bars found traces of over 100 unique specimens of urine.
Vietnam is the only country in the world that starts with V.
In "Super Mario 3D World", the Double Cherry power-up originated from a developer accidentally making two characters controllable.
The term "Spam" came before the food product "Spam".
Kissing someone for one minute burns about 2 calories.
TF2: Sentry rocket damage falloff is calculated based on the distance between the sentry and the enemy, not the engineer and the enemy
"Mongolia" was a part of the now non-existent U.S.S.R.
In Splatoon, the Squid Sisters are named Tako and Yaki.
Antarctica is the largest desert in the world.
There is a Donald Trump Board Game, which was made in 1989.
Ferrari has never made a V10 engine for any of its cars.
In the game Dead by Daylight, the killer Michael Myers is refered to as "The Shape".
In Terraria, you can craft the Cell Phone pre-hardmode.
For his performance at ComplexCon 2016 in Long Beach, California, Skrillex revived his "Mothership" set piece for one night only.
Bugatti was an Italian car manufacturer.
Oxford University is older than the Aztec Empire.
"PAYDAY: The Heist" is a sequel to the board game "Payday".
Stevie Wonder's real name is Stevland Hardaway Morris.
In Rocket League, you can play Basketball.
Nickelodeon rejected the pilot to Adventure Time.
The Klingon home planet is Qo'noS.
In "Star Trek", Klingons are commonly referred to as "Black Elves".
"Metal Gear Solid 3: Snake Eater" was released in 2004.
In "Call Of Duty: World At War", the first appearance of the "PPSH-41" in "Zombies" was in the map "Der Riese".
Scotland voted to become an independent country during the referendum from September 2014.
Several characters in "Super Mario 64" blink their eyes, including Mario himself.
"Foodfight!" earned less than $80,000 at box office.
A scalene triangle has two sides of equal length.
The commercial UK channel ITV stands for "International Television".
There are 2 player roles in Trouble in Terrorist Town.
Originally, the character Charlie from Charlie and the Chocolate Factory was going to be black.
The protagonist in "Humanity Has Declined" has no discernable name and is simply referred to as 'I' for most of the series.
The freshwater amphibian, the Axolotl, can regrow it's limbs.
Snakes and Ladders was originally created in India?
The Doppler effect applies to light.
In Norse mythology, Thor once dressed as a woman.
The main character in the "Half-Life" franchise is named Morgan Freeman.
The Tiananmen Square protests of 1989 were held in Hong Kong.
The surface area of Russia is slightly larger than that of the dwarf planet Pluto.
Gumbo is a stew that originated in Louisiana.
This is the correct spelling of "Supercalifragilisticexpialidocious".
In "Mario Kart 64", Waluigi is a playable character.
There is a city called Rome in every continent on Earth.
In the game "Melty Blood Actress Again Current Code", you can enter Blood Heat mode in Half Moon style.
The Ace Attorney trilogy was suppose to end with "Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney − Trials and Tribulations" as its final game.
It was once believed that injecting shark cartilage into people would prevent them from contracting cancer.
Tetris is the #1 best-selling video game of all-time.
In 2010, Twitter and the United States Library of Congress partnered together to archive every tweet by American citizens.
Minecraft can be played with a virtual reality headset.
The Sniper's SMG in Team Fortress 2, was originally intended to be the Scout's primary weapon.

The anime Attack on Titan was directed by Tetsurō Araki, the same person who directed the anime Highschool of the Dead.
The United States of America declared their independence from the British Empire on July 4th, 1776.
Toronto is the capital city of the North American country of Canada.
In the webcomic Homestuck, the first character introduced is Dave Strider.
The Sonoran Desert is located in eastern Africa.
The capital of the US State Ohio is the city of Chillicothe.
In most programming languages, the operator ++ is equivalent to the statement "+= 1".
The song "Mystery Train" was released by artist "Little Junior's Blue Flames" in 1953.
In Scandinavian languages, the letter Å means river.
A Saxophone is a brass instrument.
It's not possible to format a write-protected DVD-R Hard Disk.
One of Barack Obama's United States presidential campaign slogan's was "Yes We Can".
In RuneScape, one must complete the "Dragon Slayer" quest before equipping Rune Platelegs.
Linux was first created as an alternative to Windows XP.
Nazi Germany surrendered on Harry Truman's birthday while he was president.
In Heroes of the Storm, the Cursed Hollow map gimmick requires players to kill the undead to curse the enemy team.
In Rugby League, performing a "40-20" is punished by a free kick for the opposing team.
The weapon Clint Eastwood uses in "Dirty Harry" was a .44 Automag.
Helen Clark was the 37th Prime Minister of Australia.
In the "To Love-Ru" series, Peke is considered a female robot.
"Return to Castle Wolfenstein" was the only game of the Wolfenstein series where you don't play as William "B.J." Blazkowicz.
Pneumonoultramicroscopicsilicovolcanoconiosis is a synonym for the disease known as silicosis.
Michael Jackson wrote The Simpsons song "Do the Bartman".
The National Animal of Scotland is the Unicorn.
Former president Theodore Roosevelt (1900-1908)  ran for another term under the Progressive Party in 1912.
In 1993, Prince changed his name to an unpronounceable symbol because he was unhappy with his contract with Warner Bros.
Not including false teeth; A human has two sets of teeth in their lifetime.
An isosceles triangle has two sides of equal length as opposed to three.
Snagglepuss was part of the Yogi Yahooies in the 1977 show Scooby's All-Star Laff-a-Lympics.
Codemasters is the developer of the Gran Turismo series.
"Tachycardia" or "Tachyarrhythmia" refers to a resting heart-rate near or over 100 BPM.
The T-Mobile Sidekick smartphone is a re-branded version of the Danger Hiptop.

The film "2001: A Space Odyssey" was released on December 31st, 2000.
There aren't any live-action clones in "Star Wars: Episode III - Revenge of the Sith".
San Marino is the only country completely surrounded by another country.
In "Super Mario 64", collecting 100 coins on a level will give you a 1-UP.
Steel is an alloy of Iron and Carbon.
The vapor produced by e-cigarettes is actually water.
There was a satirical candidate named "Deez Nuts" running in the 2016 US presidential elections.
It is automatically considered entrapment in the United States if the police sell you illegal substances without revealing themselves.
The 'Squaring the Circle' problem is solvable.
Brezhnev was the 5th leader of the USSR.
The binary number "101001101" is equivalent to the Decimal number "334"
The bikini is named after the "Bikini Atoll", an island where the United States conducted tests on atomic bombs.
A bear does NOT defecate during hibernation.
Gothenburg is the capital of Sweden.
Scientists accidentally killed the once known world's oldest living creature, a mollusc, known to be aged as 507 years old.
If you could fold a piece of paper in half 50 times, its' thickness will be 3/4th the distance from the Earth to the Sun.
The Japanese god Izanagi successfully returned his wife Izanami from the Underworld.
Samuel L. Jackson had the words, 'Bad Motherf*cker' in-scripted on his lightsaber during the filming of Star Wars.
In 1967, a magazine published a story about extracting hallucinogenic chemicals from bananas to raise moral questions about banning drugs.
When BMW was established in 1916, it was producing automobiles.
In Team Fortress 2, being disguised as a scout or medic results in a speed boost.
The Western Electric Model 500 telephone uses tone dialing to dial phone numbers.
Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair featured all of the surviving students from the first game.
United States President Ronald Reagan was the first president to appoint a woman to the Supreme Court.
In the game "Subnautica", a "Spadefish" will attack you.
The song "Stronger Than You" is a single by Estelle, who played Garnet in Steven Universe.
Arriva is owned by the Deutsche Bahn.
An Astronomical Unit is the distance between Earth and the Moon.
Albert Einstein had trouble with mathematics when he was in school.
Mortal Kombat was almost based on Jean-Claude Van Damme movie.
In World War ll, Great Britian used inflatable tanks on the ports of Great Britain to divert Hitler away from Normandy/D-day landing.
Adolf Hitler was tried at the Nuremberg trials.
Norway has a larger land area than Sweden.
The USS Missouri (BB-63) last served in the Korean War.
Klingons express emotion in art through opera and poetry.
In "Star Trek", Klingons respect William Shakespeare, they even suspect him having a Klingon lineage.
The board game Go has more possible legal positions than the number of atoms in the visible universe.
L'Hôpital was the mathematician who created the homonymous rule that uses derivatives to evaluate limits with indeterminations.
"Santa Claus" is a variety of melon.
Linus Sebastian is the creator of the Linux kernel, which went on to be used in Linux, Android, and Chrome OS.
New Haven is the capital city of the state of Connecticut in the United States.
Activision created Battlefield 1.

John Williams composed the music for "Star Wars".
During pre-production of "Super Mario Bros.", Mario originally was meant to shoot bullets.
Lead Singer Rivers Cuomo of American rock band Weezer attended Harvard.

In the Resident Evil series, Leon S. Kennedy is a member of STARS.
AMC's "The Walking Dead", Rick, Carl, Daryl, Morgan, Carol and Maggie were introduced to us in Season 1.
Nintendo started out as a playing card manufacturer.
The Neanderthals were a direct ancestor of modern humans.
The Ceratosaurus, a dinosaur known for having a horn on the top of its nose, is also known to be a decendent of the Tyrannosaurus Rex.
The Great Wall of China is visible from the moon.
The Cold War ended with Joseph Stalin's death.
Greenland is covered with grass and Iceland covered with ice.
There are no roads in/out of Juneau, Alaska.
All program codes have to be compiled into an executable file in order to be run. This file can then be executed on any machine.
Kangaroos keep food in their pouches next to their children.
The logo for Snapchat is a Bell.
Israel is 7 hours ahead of New York.
Soccer player Cristiano Ronaldo opened a museum dedicated to himself.
The Japanese Shinkansen beat the French TGV's speed record for fastest electric rail train.
A universal set, or a set that contains all sets, exists.
The country song  “A Boy Named Sue” was written by Shel Silverstein.
Alaska is the largest state in the United States.
Furby was released in 1998.
